mdRecord.dcterms:title: History of labour in the United States / by John R. Commons, David J. Saposs, Helen L. Sumner, E. B. Mittelman, H. E. Hoagland, John B. Andrews [and] Selig Perlman; with an introductory note by Henry W. Farnam
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Andrews, John B. (John Bertram), 1880-1943
Commons, John R. (John Rogers), 1862-1945
Hoagland, Henry E. (Henry Elmer), 1886-1975
Lescohier, Don D. (Don Divance), 1883-1961
Mittelman, E. B. (Edward Becker), 1889-1949
Perlman, Selig, 1888-1959
Raushenbush, Elizabeth Brandeis.
Saposs, David J. (David Joseph), 1886-1968
Sumner, Helen L. (Helen Laura), 1876-1933
Taft, Philip, 1902-1976
mdRecord.dcterms:description: v. 1. Introduction, by J. R. Commons. Colonial and federal beginnings (to 1827) by D. J. Saposs. Citizenship (1827-1833) by Helen L. Sumner. Trade unionism (1833-1839) by E. B. Mittelman. Humanitarianism (1840-1860) by H. E. Hoagland.--v. 2. Nationalisation (1860-1877) by J. B. Andrews. Upheaval and reorganisation (since 1876) by Selig Perlman.--v. 3. Introduction to volumes III and IV, by J. R. Commons. Working conditions, by D. D. Lescohler. Labor legislation, by Elizabeth Brandeis.--v. 4. Labor movements, by Selig Perlman and Philip Taft.
Vols. 3-4 have title: History of labor in the United States, 1896-1932.

Copy 1, v. 1-2 (1921 [c1918]) Aldermn; copy 2, v. 1 ([1940, c1918]) Aldermn; copy 2, v. 2 ([1941, c1918]) Aldermn; copy 3, v. 2 (1926 [c1918]) Aldermn; copy 4, v. 1 ([1940, c1918]) Clemons; copy 4, v. 2 (1941, c1918]) Clemons.
Item X000399700 has bookplate data: George Talmage Starnes.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Labor--United States.
